'''Tucker Russell Beathard''' ({{IPAc-en||'|b|ɛ|θ||ə|r|d}} {{Respell|BETH|ərd}};<ref>[https://www.mercurynews.com/2017/08/20/49ers-analysis-how-rookie-c-j-beathard-showed-another-glimpse-of-better-days-ahead/ Brown, Daniel. "49ers Analysis: How rookie C.J. Beathard showed promise of better days ahead," ''The Mercury News'' (San Jose, CA), Sunday, August 20, 2017.] Retrieved November 27, 2020</ref> born January 24, 1995) is an American [[country music]] singer and songwriter. A son of songwriter [[Casey Beathard]], Beathard was signed to [[Dot Records|Dot]] Records, a subsidiary of [[Big Machine Records]] in 2015 where he released his debut single titled "[[Rock On (Tucker Beathard song)|Rock On]]" and released an EP titled ''[[Fight Like Hell]]'' in 2016. Since then, Beathard has departed Big Machine, releasing his debut album titled ''[[Nobody's Everything]]'' independently on November 30, 2018, and later signed to [[Warner Bros. Records|Warner Music Nashville]] in early 2019.<ref name="auto">{{cite web|url=https://musicrow.com/2019/01/tucker-beathard-signs-with-warner-music-nashville/|title=Tucker Beathard Signs With Warner Music Nashville|date=January 15, 2019}}</ref>

==Early life==
Tucker Beathard was born January 24, 1995, in [[Nashville, Tennessee]].<ref name="whitburn"/> He is the son of country music songwriter, [[Casey Beathard]], brother of [[Jacksonville Jaguars]] quarterback [[C. J. Beathard]] and grandson of [[NFL]] Hall of Famer [[Bobby Beathard]]. As a child, he played [[drum kit|drums]] in a band that also included his brothers,<ref name="amg">{{cite web|url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/tucker-beathard-mn0003424305/biography|title=Tucker Beathard biography|last=Monger|first=Timothy|work=[[Allmusic]]|access-date=16 April 2016}}</ref> but later moved to playing guitar instead.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cmt.com/news/1755687/newcomer-tucker-beathard-has-songwriting-in-his-blood/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150627030746/http://www.cmt.com/news/1755687/newcomer-tucker-beathard-has-songwriting-in-his-blood/|url-status=dead|archive-date=June 27, 2015|title=Newcomer Tucker Beathard Has Songwriting in His Blood|last=Bonaguro|first=Alison|date=June 25, 2015|work=[[Country Music Television]]|access-date=16 April 2016}}</ref> After graduating from [[Battle Ground Academy]] in 2014, he intended to play Division I baseball at [[Middle Tennessee State University]]. After tearing his shoulder, he chose to focus on music instead.<ref name="ew">{{cite magazine|url=http://www.ew.com/article/2016/02/15/tucker-beathard-rock-on|title=Nashville newcomer Tucker Beathard details new single, 'Rock On'|last=Vain|first=Madison|date=February 15, 2016|magazine=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|access-date=16 April 2016}}</ref>

==Career==
Having grown up around his father award-winning songwriter [[Casey Beathard]], Beathard spent most of his teenage years playing scattered shows with his father. There are YouTube videos that show Tucker performing originals with his dad as early as June 2013 when they played one of Tucker's earliest songs "Load The Bullets, Cock The Gun.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XEI9ZuFabI4|title=Tucker|publisher=[[YouTube]]}}</ref>

Heavily considering pursuing a career in the music industry Beathard began playing small shows scattered across the southeastern United States in late 2014.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/hear-tucker-beathards-homegrown-five-song-ep-201484/|title=Hear Tucker Beathard's Homegrown Five-Song EP|first1=Joseph|last1=Hudak|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=October 16, 2015}}</ref> In the second half of 2015 things began heating up for Beathard as he released demos of his recordings to YouTube, the tracks "Ride On", God and My Guitar and most notably "Faithful" sparked attracted fans and eventually allowed him to tour with the likes of [[Maddie and Tae]] and [[Dierks Bentley]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/tucker-beathard-faithful-video/|title=Tucker Beathard Longs for Love in 'Faithful' Video|first=Billy|last=Dukes|website=Taste of Country|date=December 7, 2015 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://musicrow.com/2015/09/tucker-beathard-joins-maddie-tae-tour/|title=Tucker Beathard Joins Maddie & Tae Tour|date=September 24, 2015}}</ref>
On September 18, 2015, it was announced Beathard was signed to [[Dot Records|Dot]] Records, a subsidiary of [[Big Machine Records|Big Machine]] Records where he would release an EP titled "[[The Demos Vol. 1]]" on October 15, 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://musicrow.com/2015/09/tucker-beathard-lands-dot-records-big-machine-music-deals/|title=Tucker Beathard Lands Dot Records, Big Machine Music Deals|date=September 18, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://musicrow.com/2015/10/tucker-beathard-releases-demos-to-spotify/|title=Tucker Beathard Releases Demos to Spotify|date=October 16, 2015}}</ref> In January 2016 it was announced Beathard would open for [[Dierks Bentley]] throughout his [[Somewhere on a Beach Tour]] summer tour.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.thecountrynote.com/in-the-news/tucker-beathard-wraps-tour-with-dierks-bentley-preps-for-headlining-dates/|title=Tucker Beathard Wraps Tour with Dierks Bentley and Preps For Headlining Dates|first=Press|last=Release|date=September 30, 2016}}</ref> On March 7, 2016, Beathard released his new single titled "[[Rock On (Tucker Beathard song)|Rock On]]" the song made its way up the charts all summer, eventually peaking at number 2 on the US Country charts.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/tucker-beathard|title=Tucker Beathard Rock On Chart History|magazine=Billboard}}</ref> "Rock On" was the lead single to Beathard's six-song EP "[[Fight Like Hell]] which was released, October 7, 2016. The EP spawned one more single titled "Momma and Jesus" but failed to be a chart success like "Rock On" was. The EP's title track "Fight Like Hell" gained a cult-like following amongst listeners, leading to multiple fans to start a trend of getting the lyrics "Fight Like Hell" tattooed onto their bodies, leading Beathard to do the same.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/tucker-beathard-gets-crazy-in-new-momma-and-jesus-music-video-watch/|title=Watch Tucker Beathard's New 'Momma and Jesus' Music Video|first=Mike|last=Thiel|website=Taste of Country|date=January 30, 2017 }}</ref><ref name="auto1">{{cite web|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/tucker-beathard-fight-like-hell-ep/|title=Tucker Beathard to Release 'Fight Like Hell' EP|first=Annie|last=Reuter|website=Taste of Country|date=September 6, 2016 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.mixcloud.com/offtherecordwithchuckwicks/off-the-record-with-tucker-beathard-talking-tattoos-sheep-music-and-more/?play=fb|title=Off The Record with Tucker Beathard!... Talking Tattoo's, Sheep, Music and More!|first=Off the Record with Chuck|last=Wick|website=Mixcloud}}</ref>

It was announced in December 2016 that Beathard would open up for [[Brantley Gilbert]] and [[Luke Combs]] on Gilbert's 2017 Devil Don't Sleep arena tour.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/tucker-beathard-brantley-gilbert-2017-devil-dont-sleep-tour-pictures/|title=Tucker Beathard Hits Evansville With Brantley Gilbert|first=Cillea|last=Houghton|website=Taste of Country|date=March 7, 2017 }}</ref>

On November 3, 2017, Beathard announced that his debut album titled "Dear Someone" would be released on November 17, 2017, and would contain thirteen tracks. Beathard released the first track titled "The Boys That Make The Most Noise", via SoundCloud the night of the announcement.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://goncc.com/tucker-beathard-set-to-release-debut-studio-album-dear-someone-november-17/|title=Tucker Beathard Set To Release Debut Studio Album 'Dear Someone' November 17|first=Mariah|last=Crom}}</ref>

On November 16, 2017, the night before his debut album for Dot Records was supposed to be released Beathard abruptly announced that the album had been postponed citing creative differences with his label Dot Records.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://bobbybones.iheart.com/featured/bobby-bones/content/2017-11-17-tucker-beathard-stops-by-talks-delay-of-new-album-performs-for-us/|title=Tucker Beathard Stops By, Talks Delay Of New Album + Performs For Us | Bobby Bones | The Bobby Bones Show|website=Bobby Bones}}</ref>

After his debut album was delayed in November 2017, Beathard began leaking demos of his recordings to YouTube so fans could still hear new music from him. The first demo being released in early December 2017 titled "Chasing You With Whiskey", this has since become a fan favorite that he gets many requests for at concerts.<ref name="auto2">{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7Jb1hDtZr_U|title=chasing you with whiskey|publisher=[[YouTube]]}}</ref>

Beathard was released from his contract with Dot Records after a mutual agreement in January 2018.

Over the course of the continuing months, Beathard was in a legal battle to maintain his songs he wrote and recorded while signed to Dot Records, however over the winter, spring and summer of 2018 Beathard leaked multiple demos of tracks to YouTube so fans could keep up where he was going with his debut record. The demo tracks he leaked were titled "Goodbye Amy", "New Me", "I Don't Miss You Now", "Perfect Imperfections", "Same Kinda Different", "This Life", "Ride On", Caught Me On A Good Night", "He Was", "Kiss Me With A Lie", "Hall of Fame", "Nobody's Everything", "New Used Oldsmobile", "She Ain't Right", "Over", "Nobody's Everything", "You Would Think Of Me", "The Closest Thing","Time These Days", "Your Dreams", "It'd Hurt Me More If You Kept Hanging Around", "Smokin' Things" and "Better Than Me".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w6MyS-wexs0|title=over|publisher=[[YouTube]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c6CczJ0X_sc|title=he was (demo)|publisher=[[YouTube]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8Fu8lY7e9qE|title=you would think of me|publisher=[[YouTube]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4Hn8K6a1Z1Y|title=your dreams (demo)|publisher=[[YouTube]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wW30HOkXpKw|title=it'd hurt me more if u kept hanging round|publisher=[[YouTube]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WXBzvHnMQIA|title=kiss me with a lie (demo)|publisher=[[YouTube]]}}</ref>

On November 26, 2018, it was announced via ''Rolling Stone'' that Beathard had settled the year-long legal battle with former label Dot Records and announced that he would be releasing his debut album independently; the album titled ''Nobody's Everything'' contained nine tracks and was released November 30, 2018. It served as the first part of a two-part album, with part two containing nine more tracks intended to be released in 2019. Beathard got the name ''Nobody's Everything'' from one of the demos he wrote and leaked to YouTube during the summer of 2018.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/tucker-beathard-new-album-nobodys-everything-759768/|title='Rock On' Singer Tucker Beathard Readies Debut Album 'Nobody's Everything'|first1=Joseph|last1=Hudak|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=November 26, 2018}}</ref>

''Nobody's Everything'' spawned the single "Ride On", which resulted in Beathard's 2019 Ride On Tour.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/tucker-beathard-2019-ride-on-tour-dates/|title=Tucker Beathard Books 2019 Ride on Tour to Play New Music|first=Annie|last=Reuter|website=Taste of Country|date=January 17, 2019 }}</ref>

On January 15, 2019, it was announced that Beathard had signed to Warner Music Nashville and would release part two of his debut album through their label.<ref name="auto"/>

On February 22, 2019, the day Beathard's ride on tour kicked off at Coyote Joes in Charlotte, North Carolina Beathard released the first single to part two of his debut album, the single titled "Better Than Me" was released for purchase on February 22, and released to radio May 6, 2019. The second single to part 2 of Beathard's debut album titled "Find Me Here" was released digitally to purchase June 3, 2019.<ref>{{cite web|author=Robert Crawford |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/tucker-beathard-better-than-me-new-album-nobodys-everything-798658/ |title=Hear Tucker Beathard's New Song 'Better Than Me' – Rolling Stone |publisher=Rollingstone.com |date=2019-02-22 |access-date=2019-09-09}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://countrymusicrocks.net/2019/04/tucker-beathard-releases-better-than-me-to-country-radio.html/|title=Tucker Beathard Releases "Better Than Me" To Country Radio|date=April 17, 2019|website=Country Music Rocks}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.entertainment-focus.com/music-section/ef-country/tucker-beathard-shares-honest-new-track-find-me-here/|title=Tucker Beathard shares honest new track Find Me Here|date=June 6, 2019}}</ref>

In September 2019 Beathard announced he would be headlining the Monster Energy Outbreak Tour in the fall of 2019, wrapping up this year with a tour to support before his new album comes out.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.monsterenergy.com/news/monster-energy-outbreak-tour-tucker-beathard-4874|title=Monster Energy Outbreak Tour: Tucker Beathard|website=Monsterenergy.com}}</ref>

Beathard released his next single "You Would Think" on February 21, 2020. The song is allegedly the lead radio single for part 2 of his debut album which is expected later this year.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://newcountrysongs.com/tucker-beathard-you-would-think/|title=Tucker Beathard - You Would Think|website=Newcountrysongs.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://americansongwriter.com/tucker-beathard-you-would-think-new-song-brooks-dunn/jim-beviglia/|title=Tucker Beathard Premieres "You Would Think" « American Songwriter|date=February 21, 2020}}</ref>

On February 22, 2020, while performing at the [[Grand Ole Opry]], Beathard debuted a new song titled "I Ain't Without You", about his late brother who had died in December 2019.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KxMrDXok-8o&feature=youtu.be |title=Tucker Beathard - I Ain't Without You - YouTube |website=www.youtube.com |access-date=13 January 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201102122836/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KxMrDXok-8o&feature=youtu.be |archive-date=2 November 2020 |url-status=dead}}</ref>

On August 21, 2020, Beathard released his second studio album ''[[King (Tucker Beathard album)|King]]'', which included previously released singles "Better Than Me", "Find Me Here", "Can't Stay Here", and "You Would Think". This album was the second half to the double album concept that Beathard talked about doing after releasing his first studio album, ''Nobody's Everything''.<ref name="warnermusicnashville.com">{{Cite web|url=https://www.warnermusicnashville.com/news/tucker-beathard-finds-his-voice-new-album-king-available-august-21-4326#:~:text=Warner%20Music%20Nashville%20recording%20artist%20and%20%E2%80%9Ca%20singer%2Fsongwriter%20with,to%20pre%2Dorder%20now%20HERE.|title = Tucker Beathard Finds His Voice with New Album ''King'' – Available August 21 - Warner Music Nashville Official News| date=August 1970 }}</ref>

Beathard released the single titled "Prayin' for You" on December 10, 2021.

In late October 2022 it was announced Beathard would release his new single "One Of Those" on November 4, 2022.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.enigmaonline.com/2022/11/04/tucker-beathard-releases-new-track-one-of-those/ | title=Tucker Beathard Releases New Track "One of Those" – Enigma Online | date=November 4, 2022 }}</ref>

In early 2023 Tucker teased multiple new songs via his official social media pages, sharing acoustic and demo versions of new songs titled "Good One to End On", "I Owe You One" and "Good News". On February 4, 2023, Tucker Beathard announced he will be releasing his next new single "Who I Am With You" on February 10, 2023, a song Beathard previously announced and shared a stripped down acoustic version of on January 19, 2021, via his official Instagram and Facebook pages.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.instagram.com/p/CoNNWjJg1LW/ | title=Tucker Beathard on Instagram: "excited to be putting out a new song. "who I am with you" is out next Friday. Pre save it at the link in my bio" }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=https://genius.com/Tucker-beathard-who-i-am-with-you-lyrics | title=Tucker Beathard – Who I Am with You }}</ref>

== Personal life ==
In December 2019, a few days before [[Christmas]] Beathard's younger brother Clay Beathard was stabbed and killed alongside his friend Paul Trapeni<ref>{{cite web |date=December 29, 2019 |title=Funerals held for stabbing victims Clay Beathard, Paul Trapeni |url=https://www.wcbi.com/funerals-held-for-stabbing-victims-clay-beathard-paul-trapeni/}}</ref> outside of a bar in [[Nashville]] while protecting a girl who was being assaulted by the assailant Michael Mosley.<ref>{{cite web |date=March 31, 2022 |title=Mosley found guilty in fatal 2019 double stabbing |url=https://www.williamsonherald.com/news/local_news/mosley-found-guilty-in-fatal-2019-double-stabbing/article_9fa27e60-b167-11ec-855b-834aa0be5ae9.html}}</ref> At Clay's funeral, Beathard alongside his brother, [[C. J. Beathard]],<ref>{{cite web |date=December 29, 2019 |title=Watch 49ers QB C.J. Beathard's emotional eulogy at brother's funeral |url=https://www.nbcsports.com/bayarea/49ers/watch-49ers-qb-cj-beathards-emotional-eulogy-brothers-funeral}}</ref> and parents gave their eulogies which was streamed live on local news stations and via social media.<ref>{{cite web |date=December 28, 2019 |title=Funerals held for Nashville stabbing victims Clayton Beathard and Paul Trapeni III |url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/49ers-quarterback-brother-funeral-clayton-beathard-brother-of-c-j-beathard-and-paul-trapeni-iii-funeral-services-held/ |website=[[CBS News]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |date=December 28, 2019 |title=Beathard and Trapeni: College students stabbed to death laid to rest |url=https://www.newschannel5.com/news/the-funeral-arrangements-for-the-two-college-students-stabbed-to-death-have-been-made}}</ref>

On July 13, 2020, in a very personal announcement, Beathard revealed to fans that he had become a father via his social media pages.<ref>{{cite web |date=July 14, 2020 |title=Country singer Tucker Beathard reveals he's a dad: 'The greatest blessing I could possibly ask for' |url=https://www.foxnews.com/entertainment/country-singer-tucker-beathard-reveals-dad |website=[[Fox News]]}}</ref> His daughter, named "Sage" was born in July 2018.<ref>{{cite web |date=July 14, 2020 |title=Tucker Beathard Reveals He's a Father, Wishes His Daughter a Happy 2nd Birthday |url=https://tasteofcountry.com/tucker-beathard-daughter//}}</ref>
